bio: Born in New York and raised all over, Adam has a distinct perspective on the world. Being Black and Jewish, he brings culture and diversity to his music.

Who is Art Beagle and why does he have a back up band?  Never mind about that... Art Beagle's Back Up Band is a Minneapolis based trio that plays Jazz Standards, R&B/Soul/Pop covers from 50's to 90's as well as original music written by its members.  This trio features the talents of: Michael Burton on keyboards guitar, vocals and trombone: Originally from Minneapolis, Michael has played guitar, keyboards, trombone and other instruments with various bands and artists, including Shakedown City, Elena, and the Classics Big Band.  Michael can be seen regularly in various theater productions in the Twin Cities area. Yoji Sera on drums: Originally from Tokyo, Japan.  Yoji developed a love for Jazz during his early college days in Ohio. Yoji has performed with several bands in the Twin Cities area in the past few years. Tamir Nolley on bass/saxophone: Originally from Minneapolis, Tamir has performed on bass and/or saxophone with various artists including Shakedown City, The Express Band, The Esperanza Ensemble.  Tamir has been teaching at Hopewell Music Cooperative-North since its founding and is the director of the school's Jazz Ensemble… and who knows, Art might just show up to one of his gigs….
Incredibly above average. Songs you know and love in a way you've never heard them before.

BANW writes songs for working class people who hate working but have no way out. We try our best to make light of dark times and sprinkle some humor over genuine tales of misery. People have told us we sound like Jawbreaker, Toys That Kill, and Against Me!
3 separate songwriters and singers join forces for new all original project.

Couch Potato Massacre write fun, catchy pop punk tunes in a style often called Ramonescore. Their debut album was released on California label OutLoud Records and they have opened for bands like Chixdiggit, Kepi Ghoulie, and City Mouse. If you enjoy movies like Army of Darkness or Bill and Ted's Excellent Adventure, you'll probably love Couch Potato Massacre.

Playing songs inspired equally by Springsteen, Alan Jackson, & the Ramones, the Denim Boys have no idea what they’re doing but promise you’ll have a great time. In fact, if you come to a Denim Boys show and don’t have fun, you can either sue them or come to their house, take your shirt off, and fight them.

Emily Boyajian is a pianist and classical music composer living in Uptown, who uses her strong background in music theory to write music that is intellectually stimulating and emotionally captivating. She has written solo piano works, chamber music, orchestral music, and art songs. Outside of music, she also enjoys doing improv theater, playing board games, biking, and volunteering for LGBT groups.
Music for your Sunday mornings.

GardenStreet is a Twin Cities based quartet that explores blues, rock and grunge and puts a variable setlist together, mixing original songs with covers. Lead singer Troy Kittinger uses his raspy voice to give the band a very unique sound. He’s accompanied by Andrew Guerin on guitar, Brian Engel on drums, and Felipe Herrera on bass.

band_name: John Forrest and the Model Citizens
bio: John Forrest and The Model Citizens are a Twin Cities-based band that has been playing shows all around the area since pre-pandemic. With an upbeat and danceable sound the music tries to capture the changing dynamics of love, self-destruction, loneliness, and isolation in the digital age. John Forrest and the Model Citizens has twice been featured as The Current’s song of the day, and they look forward to continuing to build a following in and around the Twin Cities.

American singer and songwriter Jordy Vaughn captures listeners with her brilliant vocals and emotive lyrics. Taking inspiration from legendary female vocalists such as Judy Garland, Amy Winehouse, and Regina Spektor, Vaughn eloquently blends elements of folk, jazz, and soul in her music creating an uplifting and relaxing sound that fills the heart.

Joseph Damman is a guitarist and composer from Minneapolis, Minnesota whose style combines folk, jazz, various African music, and other worldwide influences into a unique stew with an emphasis on improvisation. He has performed in the Twin Cities since 2007, leading a trio playing his original music and performing in various ensembles with Milo Fine, Davu Seru, Louis Alemayehu, Tom Reichert, Mankwe Ndosi, Chris Bates, Truthmaze, and many others. His music embodies a spiritual commitment to caring, healing, and harmony with the natural world. This performance will feature original solo guitar compositions and folk melody arrangements.

genre: Halloween Themed Gothic Jazz / Doom Folk
bio: King Sized Coffin is a 7-person band pioneering the concept of original Halloween music. Their music is for all ages and explores multiples genres such as folk, punk, rockabilly, hot club jazz, and americana. Based in Minneapolis, Minnesota, the group is composed of Alex Paulson on trombone and guitar, Andy Nelson on mandolin, kazoo, and harmonica, Billy Bob Rayson on percussion and saxophone, Graham Morris on guitar, Matt “Eagle Eyes” Higgins on bass, McLean Baran on theremin and banjo, and Paul “Popeye” McNamee on vocals. The band works collectively to write original music drawing from their individual backgrounds. The band was interviewed on Real Music Radio and their first show was warmly reviewed by Melodic Noise Media. The band is soon to release a full length album.
Sam just thinks we're a Weezer ripoff. Tom thinks Brad should get over his ex. Brad just wants to dance. Instead it's 3am and we're still staring at the ceiling fan.

After a decade of playing gigs both large and small around the city of Chicago with indie rockers, Buckman Page, as well as with front porch folkers, Distant Brothers, Matty and his partner packed up their lives and moved to northeast Minneapolis in 2021. His current musical project, "Matty & The Subtle Validation" stems from something of a quest to find ways to connect with and to validate others through music. He's not an expert and it may not even be something he's very good at, but the bottom line is this: no matter who you are or where you're from, everyone deserves value.
Begun in 1990 Mommy Log Balls has undergone several iterations…

We’re a brand new 6 - 9 piece Minneapolis based indie/rock band with a brass and string section delivering eclectic sounds, unique lyrics and a powerful message. Our mission is to use our music to fight against racism and inequity.

Poorwill is a Minneapolis-based indie rock band with a yeehaw lilt. They formed in 2019, with most of them having no experience playing their instruments or being in a band. In 2020 they released their first EP titled Tough Kid, which featured songs about being in your early 20s and feelings of growing up and moving on. After a short hiatus, they are planning to release their second EP in 2023.

When bandmember Wes was planning his wedding, he wanted to include something special. He called upon his friends to assemble and play a few songs with him during his reception. The wedding came and went, but the group didn’t want to stop playing music. Thus, Putz and the Morons was born!

We are a group of lifelong musicians who met in college and just can’t stop making music! Our sound blends folk, classic rock, country, and vocal harmony to create a unique experience that’s sure to be loved by all. You’ll see us playing a wide range of instruments - banjos, melodicas, manolins, bass trombones, and more. Come hang out with us and enjoy classic tunes…folk-ified!

*Splash!* music is a curated collection of reflections inspired by philosophy, mysticism, and spiritual practice, paired with soaring ethereal melodies to produce songs that are at once grounding and transcendent.

In the epicenter of grunge laden metal, garage rock, and funky angst pop lies one band. Splimit. Established in 2012 juggernauts Mitchell Benson & Mike Herold have been on a nonstop quest to deliver a band that makes an audience listen, question, and demand attention. With a genre bending mentality, these musicians continue to incorporate diverse musical ideas into an unfailing vibration of individuality. You can now find Splimit’s newest E.P “D. All of The Above” on major streaming platforms.

Rooted in American Folk Music, StoryHorse is a local band performing Blues, Rock, and Country. The band features five multi-instrumental band members covering a vast range of music from Taj Mahal to Doc Watson and everything in-between.

Tarli, formally known as EL.i.BE, has been creating waves in the Twin Cities hip-hop scene for over a decade. As a homage to his native country Liberia, his middle name, "Tarli," originates from his mother's tribe, meaning: "successful journey." Tarli's powerful lyrical journey encompasses the beauty and challenges of being a first-generation refugee in America. Joined by "The Tribe" (Graydon Francis & IamKaye [Sounds of Blackness], Wes., & DJ MidiEvil), Tarli brings an eclectic sound ranging from Boom Bap to Soul to New School Hip-Hop to every performance.
The Hazy Phase formed in the Minneapolis area in the spring of 2020. The band is a unique sound that is part garage rock with a healthy dose of old school blues.
The Tom O'Bedlam is a storyteller, songwriter, and shapeshifter based out of North Minneapolis. He tells true stories about fictional people rooted in that place where magic meets mundane.

Introducing Fever Field: an indie rock and pop sensation from Uptown, Minnesota. Jack Cassidy, Liam Conzemius, Jordan Zachmann, and Drew Lodermeier, all St. John’s University alumni, came together in 2022 to form the band. Their signature blend of indie rock and pop, showcased in both original compositions and innovative covers, captures the essence of their love for music making. Rooted in the vibrant culture of Uptown, Fever Field's captivating melodies and honest performances are not to be missed.
